text: well let's go now to moscow we can hear
from our correspondent there jenny hill
jenny first of all the impact of the
economic moves that have been made
against russia we're hearing this
morning that the ruble is crashing tell
us more about that impact
yeah quite right the um ruble has sunk
to another record low um the moscow
central bank uh russia's central bank
has doubled its key interest rates from
nine percent to 20 percent and they've
been cues at some cash points um around
the country for several days now as
people try to get as much cash as they
can but i think um your average russian
probably isn't noticing too much of a
difference right now that will of course
change bear in mind though that very
many people here in russia get their
main information from state television
which continues to celebrate and support
mr putin and his war in ukraine not that
that's what they're calling it um and
they are perpetuating the message from
the kremlin which is that it is prepared
for western sanctions it was expecting
those western sanctions and even when
those sanctions do start to bite and
people really start to feel the pinch
here um the kremlin is likely to
continue its message which is that these
are another illustration of western
aggression
against russia just yesterday when mr
putin announced that he was putting
russia's nuclear deterrence forces on a
higher state of alert he said he was
doing so in response not only to nato
aggression but very specifically in
response to western economic sanctions
too
we were hearing just in the past few
moments from
president vladimir zelinsky that four
and a half thousand russian soldiers
have been killed so far jenny um there's
been a lot of discussion around this not
unfolding as russia had foreseen as as
we go into day five of the russian
invasion what is the message there from
how things are unfolding in ukraine
well the kremlin is keeping an extremely
tight grip on how the information is
being disseminated here in in in russia
so this morning we had yet another
update from the ministry of defence
talking about the gains that russia is
making saying that they have now
destroyed something like 1 100 military
targets in ukraine um no mention at all
of any russian casualties in that daily
report now this is interesting because
just yesterday for the very first time
the ministry did admit that there had
been losses but it did not specify
numbers or give any further details and
actually the authorities here um have
now banned an independent website which
had been publishing information about
dead and captured russian soldiers so
the kremlin continues to try and keep a
lid on the way that this invasion is
being presented and the information
coming in to its citizens of course it
continues to pump out state television
continues to pump out mr putin's
narrative which is that this is not a
russian aggression this is a special
military operation which was necessary
to defend the russian-speaking
population of eastern ukraine against
the so-called aggression of the
government
in kiev
jenny thank you very much that's jenny
hill in moscow
